# preferredFontDescriptor(forTextStyle:options:)

**Type Method**

Returns a font descriptor that contains the text style.

## Declaration

```swift
class func preferredFontDescriptor(forTextStyle style: NSFont.TextStyle, options: [NSFont.TextStyleOptionKey : Any] = [:]) -> NSFontDescriptor
```

## Parameters

- **style**: The text style for which to return a font descriptor. See [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSFont/TextStyle] for available values.
- **options**: A dictionary you use to further configure the returned font descriptor. See [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSFont/TextStyleOptionKey] for a list of valid keys. Pass an empty dictionary to use the default configuration.

## Return Value

The font descriptor that contains the text style.

## Discussion

The font descriptor contains a dictionary of attributes that you use to create an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSFont] object. See [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSFontDescriptor] for more information.

## Creating a Font Descriptor

- **init(name:matrix:)**: Returns a font descriptor with the name and matrix attributes set to the given values.
- **init(name:size:)**: Returns a font descriptor with the name and size attributes set to the given values.
- **init(fontAttributes:)**: Initializes and returns a new font descriptor with the specified attributes.
